page.title: 11TWO METHODIST CHAPELS.
page.content: The chapels at Peters Marland and Rowden were built in 1873 and 1905 respectively, and became part of the Methodist Church in 1932. The Minister takes services at the chapels on a rota basis, with accredited Lay Preachers when he is not available. Rowden has two services every Sunday and special services such as Harvest Festivals which are well attended as many people from other parishes have friends or relatives buried in the old graveyard there, and always come on those days. Some chapel members also belong to the Circuit Choir. Peters Marland, with a membership of just 12, hold their services fortnightly.
